title: Tapper: What are Americans to make of these images?
description: CNN's Jake Tapper examines various incidents of police brutality caught on camera amid protests following the death of George Floyd.

title: Trump's most self-defeating move
description: Abraham Lincoln knew the value of a good photo. In February 1860, the former congressman from Illinois posed for Matthew Brady in the pioneering photographer's New York studio. The resulting image concealed some cosmetic flaws, giving Lincoln a determined look. It was widely distributed and credited with helping him win the nomination and the presidency.

title: Former Republican Secretary of State rebukes Trump
Police horse causes havoc at London protest
description: Thousands of demonstrators gathered in London on Saturday, in a largely peaceful protest against the death of George Floyd and systemic racism in the United States and around the world.

title: Former Republican Secretary of State rebukes Trump
description:
• Colin Powell says he will vote for Biden
• Powell gets emotional: This is America

title: Atlanta mayor says she is disgusted by Trump's invocation of George Floyd
description: Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms said she was "simply disgusted" by President Donald Trump's invoking George Floyd's name during a Friday bill signing ceremony touting the latest jobs report, which exceeded economists' expectations.

title: Colin Powell gets emotional: This is America
description: Former Secretary of State Colin Powell responds to the protests surrounding the death of George Floyd and systemic racism in the United States.

title: Trump's evident character flaws leave him unable to meet the historic moment
Australian surfer dies after being bitten by a great white shark nearly 10 feet long
description: A 60-year-old surfer died Sunday in Australia after being bitten by a great white shark that was nearly ten feet long, authorities say.

title: UFC star Conor McGregor said he is retiring from fighting
description: Mixed martial arts fighter Conor McGregor announced his retirement from the sport on social media Sunday.

title: Trump showed that his baser instincts will prevail
description: There was a fleeting moment after the killing of George Floyd when President Donald Trump seemed open to some semblance of dialogue about systematic racism and police brutality when he called Floyd's death a "grave tragedy" that filled Americans with "horror, anger and grief."

title: Trump's historically strong with his base -- and that's his problem
description: Poll of the week: A new national Monmouth University poll finds that former Vice President Joe Biden leads President Donald Trump by a 52% to 41% margin.

title: The US President's absence of empathy and candor leaves him uniquely ill-equipped to handle the intertwined challenges the nation now faces
description: "In a president, character is everything," wrote the renowned speechwriter Peggy Noonan. And therein lies President Donald Trump's inability to meet this American moment.

title: My friend chose an assisted death in Switzerland. Her dying wish was to tell you why
description: Shortly after 11 a.m. on December 16, 2019, Cindy Siegel Shepler drew her last breath in a spartan room in Basel, Switzerland.

title: Where a stay-at-home order is its own sort of death sentence
description: When the coronavirus pandemic began to spread through Colombia, creeping its way to the town of Uribia, the only information Angela Montiel could get about Covid-19 was from her neighbors.

title: Bayern Munich sports armbands in solidarity with Black Lives Matter movement
description: With its players sporting armbands supporting the Black Lives Matter movement, Bayern Munich maintained its seven-point lead atop the Bundesliga with a 4-2 win at fifth-placed Bayer Leverkusen Saturday.

title: Germany and US leading the way in crucial period for women's football
description: Danielle Young cried when she learned her football team was to be disbanded.

title: Robin DiAngelo: How 'white fragility' supports racism and how whites can stop it
Tens of thousands march in largest Floyd protests so far in the United States
Black Lives Matter supporters gather across globe
description: Thousands of peaceful protesters have gathered in London, across Europe, Africa and Asia, protesting the death of George Floyd and systemic racism in the United States and around the world.

title: University of North Carolina Wilmington calls professor's tweets 'vile and inexcusable' following growing backlash online
description: A professor at the University of North Carolina Wilmington has come under fire for tweets he posted which the school has called "vile and inexcusable," according to a statement the school provided to CNN Saturday.

title: George Floyd protests are only getting bigger
description: Massive demonstrations across large US cities -- and small ones too -- have been underway for nearly two weeks and protesters show no signs of slowing down.

title: Coral reefs are facing their own pandemic -- but we have a survival guide
description: Coral reefs are facing their own pandemic. For years, people have compromised the immunity of these ecosystems through pollution and overfishing. Meanwhile, climate change has created a fever in our oceans by raising temperatures and acidifying seas. The resulting outbreak has decimated approximately half of the world's reefs.

title: India and China agree to peacefully resolve border dispute, New Delhi says
description: India and China have agreed to peacefully resolve a simmering border dispute between the world's two most populous nations, officials in New Delhi said.

title: Newspaper's top editor steps down after publishing 'Buildings Matter, Too' headline
description: The top editor of the Philadelphia Inquirer has stepped down from his role after the newspaper published an article with the headline "Buildings Matter, Too," last week, according to an internal memo sent to newsroom staff and obtained by CNN.

title: There's a growing call to defund the police. Here's what it means
description: There's a growing group of dissenters who believe Americans can survive without law enforcement as we know it. And Americans, those dissenters believe, may even be better off without it.

title: A teen who spent 10 hours cleaning up after a protest is rewarded with a car and a college scholarship
description: When Antonio Gwynn Jr. saw the damage from protests in his hometown of Buffalo, New York, he grabbed a broom, bought some trash bags and started cleaning the streets by himself.

title: After reviewing video, prosecutors charge police inspector instead of protester
description: A Philadelphia police inspector is facing charges after prosecutors said a video shows him striking a student protester on the head with a metal baton.

title: White House wanted 10k active duty troops to quell protesters
description: The White House wanted to have 10,000 active duty troops on the streets of Washington and other cities earlier this week to quell protesters, but Secretary of Defense Mark Esper and Chairman of the Joint of Chiefs of Staff General Mark Milley pushed back at the use of any active duty troops, according to a senior defense official.

title: As people resume work, these seven kinds of jobs are making the biggest return
description: As the US reopens in phases, more and more jobs are being added back to the economy. Unemployment officially fell to 13.3% in May as employers added 2.5 million jobs, the best month for job growth since the Bureau of Labor Statistics started tracking the data in 1939.

title: No taller than 500M, no plagiarism: China signals 'new era' for architecture
description: An end to "copycat" buildings and a ban on skyscrapers taller than 500 meters (1,640 feet) are among the Chinese government's new guidelines for architects, property developers and urban planners.

title: Texas county GOP chair-elect won't assume office amid backlash for posting MLK quote with a banana
description: A Texas Republican county chairman-elect said Saturday he won't assume office amid backlash over posting a controversial image of a Martin Luther King Jr. quote with a banana in the picture.

title: The Mormon church's century-long mission to crack China
description: Every Sunday, when members of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (LDS) meet in the conference room of a blue-glass skyscraper in downtown Shanghai, one person always takes a seat right at the back, by the doors.

title: Demonstrators say it's worth braving coronavirus to protest George Floyd's killing
description: Jazondre Gibbs was up early Saturday morning, packing her car and driving with her mom into the center of Washington, DC. She wanted to be there in time to park and set up a table loaded with bags of snacks, water, hand sanitizer and other supplies to hand out to crowds demonstrating after the death of George Floyd.
